availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher A. Biggerstaff (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Biggerstaff and Rachael A. Biggerstaff. Resident of Christian County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860 and 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 419; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 142; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Christian County, KY, July 1863, p. 2, (Accessed via ancestry.com); Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), 1926, Christian County, Kentucky, File no. 528; KYR-0001-029-0532.
